documents.title: norfolk live signing off
text: it 's 18:00 on a friday , so if you 're one of our regular followers , you 'll know this is where we sign off until monday morning .
if you 're just joining us , these are some of the stories we 've been looking at during the day :
this year we 've created our very own norfolk live advent calendar , so here 's our offering for day 2 :

documents.title: how a banned gig led to a student sit-in
text: after the sex pistols ' gig was banned ( see below ) , 50 students occupied the uea 's administration block in protest .
vice-chancellor dr frank thistlethwaite agreed to pay the students ' union £ 750 to reimburse it for the money it lost through the cancellation .
documents in the uea archives from the time make fascinating reading .
you can read more about the cancelled gig , and how the pistols faced bans up and down the country , on the bbc norfolk page tomorrow .
author: Jon Welch
BBC News

documents.title: weather : risk of frost tonight , staying dry tomorrow
text: this evening will be rather cloudy with some showers clearing eastwards .
clear spells will develop and bring the risk of a frost in places and the odd fog patch .
lows of -1 to 4c ( 30 - 39f ) .
saturday will be a little cloudy at times , but staying dry with some bright or sunny spells .
chance of an isolated shower in eastern counties , with highs of 7c ( 45f ) .
there 's more at bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: the sex pistols and the gig that never was
text: tomorrow marks a notable anniversary in norwich - of something that did n't happen , rather than did .
on 3 december 1976 , the sex pistols were due to play the first date of their anarchy in the uk tour at the university of east anglia .
but the gig never took place .

university vice-chancellor dr frank thistlethwaite banned them from playing `` on the grounds of protecting the safety and security of persons and property '' following their controversial tv appearance with bill grundy , two days earlier .
author: Jon Welch
BBC News

documents.title: appeal for witnesses to snettisham collision
text: police are appealing for witnesses to a collision on the a149 dersingham by-pass at snettisham yesterday afternoon .
three vehicles , a green suzuki alto , a black jaguar , and a toyota gt86 were involved in the crash , which took place just after 17:00 .
the drivers of the suzuki and the jaguar were taken to the queen elizabeth hospital where they remain in a critical but stable condition .
the third driver was treated at the scene and discharged .

documents.title: norfolk harvest mouse 'very gentle and easy to work with '
text: we 've been covering the story of a norfolk harvest mouse which has a star role in sunday 's bbc1 's planet earth ii programme .
producer and director chadden hunter told us they 're `` very gentle and easy-to-work-with animals '' that weigh the same as a two pence piece .

he said : `` what we wanted to do was capture this amazing acrobatic display that they do , as they climb from one grass blade to another - they really do climb between the grass stems like a monkey through trees . ''
here 's some of the footage :

documents.title: shrimp restrictions `` will not affect catches in the wash ''
text: the body which overseas fishing along the norfolk coast says a proposal to restrict the catching of shrimp in the wash will protect the environment and keep the area sustainable .

the inshore fisheries and conservation authority ( ifca ) was criticised in parliament yesterday by west norfolk mp sir henry bellingham who described the proposal as a `` potential crisis '' for the industry and claimed it was being forced through by the european union .
but the local boss of ifca , julian gregory , said the british government has made a commitment to protect the waters around the coast and limiting the places where shrimp can be caught will help .
`` we absolutely must meet the conservation objectives for a marine protected area , '' he said .
`` we believe our proposals will enable us to do that in a way that still enables fishing activity to continue . ''
under the proposals , 14 % of the wash will be closed to shrimp fishing , but mr gregory said there would still be enough space for fishermen to catch elsewhere .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: protest over lack of disabled access to norwich assessment office
text: a group of disabled people have protested outside a disability assessment centre in norwich , which they say is n't fit for purpose .

offices in st francis house , in queens road , are used by the company atos - which assesses disabled people for the government to see if they 're entitled to financial support under the personal independence payments scheme .
there 's no on-site parking and the ramp at the back leads to a door which has n't been widened to accommodate wheelchairs ( see below ) .
mark harrison from the campaign group equal lives said he thought it was a disgrace .
`` we have been on at atos and the department for work and pensions for the last 18 months , but they have refused to budge , '' he said .
`` they even sent somebody done here to assess it .
they accepted it is not accessable , but they are not going to do anything about it . ''
atos said it recognises the parking at the centre could be improved and said an intercom is going to be installed to make it easier for people to use the back door .
author: Clare Worden
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: speedway : stars re-sign huckenbeck for 2017
text: king 's lynn stars have confirmed that kai huckenbeck will ride for the team next season .
the 23-year-old german was with the club in the elite league in 2016 and is the second member of the next year 's team to be confirmed , after denmark 's nicklas porsing .
lynn team manager dale allitt said : `` i think kai would be the first to admit he found things difficult from time to time in 2016 .
`` however , it 's never easy in your first year in a new league , yet he still showed us glimpses of what he is capable of . ''
he 's back | kai huckenbeck is our second rider for the 2017 season .

documents.title: remember this : anti-nuclear protests at swaffham 1958
text: fifty eight years ago this month , police were photographed carrying off two demonstrators during a protest outside the thor missile site at swaffham , norfolk .
the site was for thor intermediate range nuclear ballistic missiles .
the protestors were members of the direct action committee against nuclear war .
the missiles would have been used by no 220 squadron raf .
the squadron was deactivated in 1963 and the missiles removed .

documents.title: walsham attempt to cement top four place
text: north walsham head to thurrock this weekend in rugby union 's london league one north .
the vikings returned to form last weekend , beating letchworth garden city 54-12 , having lost their previous two league matches .
they remain fourth in london one north .
tomorrow 's opponents are two places and three points behind walsham .
thurrock have only lost once at home so far this season .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: did norfolk writer 's essex serpent escape from the tower of london ?
text: we 're been talking to norwich writer sarah perry about her novel the essex serpent , which has just won the waterstones book of the year award .
the story first surfaced in written form in a pamphlet produced in 1669 which says the account of the giant serpent appearing near henham in essex was `` attested by many credible persons '' .
`` it 's a great unsolved mystery .
some say it was all a hoax , a monster that was hand-built by a man and his son , '' said perry .

`` others say it was a crocodile and some such creature escaped from the tower of london ( which contained a royal menagerie from the time of king john to 1832 ) and made its way to the essex marshes . ''
she said she was always interested in myths and the `` dark places that inhabit the corner of your eyes '' .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: from the archives : geese plucking in norfolk 1911
text: this month 105 years ago , two women and a young boy were caught on camera plucking geese for market on a norfolk poultry farm .

documents.title: support for pregnant women with mental health problems
text: support for women who suffer mental health problems while pregnant or just after giving birth has been boosted by a £ 2.5m grant in norfolk and waveney .

the money will fund care for pregnant women and new mothers with serious mental health difficulties , as well as providing support for the rest of the family and training for other healthcare professionals .

norfolk and suffolk nhs foundation trust ( nsft ) and norfolk 's clinical commissioning groups were awarded the grant by nhs england to work with partners to develop the specialist community service .

work has now started to recruit consultant psychiatrists to lead the service , as well as mental health nurses , a psychologist , occupational therapist , social worker , nursery nurses and administrators , who will complete the 14-strong team .

it is hoped all posts will be filled by march.andy goff , development manager with nsft , said : it 's great news that there will now be a specific service caring for women and their babies , as it is such a specialist area of work . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: work starts on £ 3.8m to transform primary school
text: work has started on a £ 3.8m project to transform ashleigh primary school in wymondham by building nine new classrooms , extending the hall , creating a new kitchen , and remodelling other parts of the school .

it 's part of a £ 5m reorganisation by norfolk county council to increase the number of primary age places in the town from 1,050 and 1,260 and enable robert kett , browick road and ashleigh schools to educate children right through from age 4-11 .

sam nixon , head teacher at ashleigh said : `` the whole school community has been involved in planning our development to primary and are delighted that wymondham will benefit from having such an exceptional school site and facilities . ''
the work at ashleigh school is expected to be completed for the new 2017-18 school year .
all of the wymondham school projects are designed and built by nps property consultants ltd .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: norfolk mouse becomes star of bbc 's planet earth ii
text: a mouse from norfolk is set to become a television star with its appearance on the bbc 's planet earth ii on sunday as the only native english animal filmed for this episode .
the harvest mouse is captured on camera using its agility to escape from an owl .
presenter and naturalist david attenborough describes how the mouse uses its tail `` like a fifth limb '' .
using a specially developed crane-arm the team were able to make the camera go where a cameraman could n't .

the film follows a tiny harvest mouse as she climbs through the grass canopy `` revealing the intimacy of never-before-seen , new-born babies inside a tiny hidden 'tree house ' nest a metre above the ground '' .
harvest mice are the smallest rodents in europe .
an adult weighs less than a two pence piece .
they are the only rodent in europe with a prehensile tail which they can wrap around branches and hang from .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: 'arson attack ' on vehicles in norwich
text: two vans appear to have been set on fire deliberately in norwich in the early hours of this morning .
norfolk police say the two vehicles were in a secure yard at barker street .
two fire engines were sent to tackle it just before 02:00 .
police are now investigating .

documents.title: norwich writer 's award-winning novel inspired by essex drive
text: a norfolk writer , who won the waterstones book of the year award with her second novel the essex serpent , has spoken of her inspiration for the book .
sarah perry 's book is loosely based around a folk tale about the serpent of henham , near saffron walden , which was retold in a 17th century pamphlet ( above ) .

ms perry ( below ) , who was born in chelmsford and now lives in norwich , said : `` my husband and me are both from essex and we were driving through henham when he asked me if i had heard about the story of the essex serpent which a 1669 pamphlet says was seen menacing the villages .

`` and i thought : 'what if it came back in the 19th century at the time of charles darwin ( and the then new theory of evolution ) and i talked to my husband for about 45 minutes and mapped out the novel . ''
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: carrow road to pay tribute to chapecoense victims
text: norwich city will hold a minute 's silence ahead of tomorrow 's championship match against brentford .

football clubs across the country will pay tribute to the victims of the plane crash in colombia earlier this week which killed 71 people , including many players and officials from the brazilian club chapecoense .
players will also wear black armbands for the game at carrow road .
a minute 's silence will be held on saturday to remember the victims of the colombian air disaster .

documents.title: new extension at school in snettisham
text: a new extension and play ground are being opened today at snettisham primary school near hunstanton .
the extension has cost £ 200,000 and will give the pre-school children and the willow class a new home .

documents.title: train fares to rise by average of 2.3 %
text: we do n't like to start your day with bad news , but if you are off to get a train then i 'm afraid fares in britain will go up by an average of 2.3 % from 2 january .
the increase in regulated fares , which includes season tickets , is capped at july 's rpi inflation rate of 1.9 % .
unregulated fares , such as off-peak leisure tickets , can go up by as much as the train companies like .
the rail delivery group , which represents train operators and network rail , said the industry was working to simplify fares and improve services .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: suspended duo back to try and halt canaries ' win-less run
text: norwich city return to carrow road this weekend for the first time in a month .
they have lost their last five championship matches and have slipped to eighth in the table..
the canaries ' last win was against bottom club rotherham on 15 october .
city left back martin olsson and midfielder graham dorrans are both back in the squad after suspension for saturday 's match against brentford , who themselves have lost their last three games .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

text: a school near cromer is closed today because of a high level of staff illness .
the twitter account for sidestrand hall school shows a letter from the head teacher - sarah young - that explains it 's shut so a deep clean of the premises can take place .
unfortunately , due to a high level of staff sickness , we will be shut tomorrow .
sorry for the inconvenience .

text: prison officer leaders back pay deal

documents.title: wash fishermen face 'potential crisis '
text: the norfolk mp sir henry bellingham has told mps that fishermen in the wash are facing a potential crisis because of plans to bring in a new permit scheme for shrimp fishing .
the proposals from the european union , which would come into effect before brexit , are designed to protect the seabed but sir henry questioned if they would really work .

`` we want a proportionate and common sense approach to this problem and i really ask the minister to look at this because this fishery will be under a lot of pressure [ if this happens ] , '' he said .
the north west norfolk mp was speaking in a debate on the future of the british fishing industry .
he said that the common fisheries policy had been `` a disaster '' and leaving the eu presented `` a massive opportunity '' .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: hey punk museum needs your memories
text: `` sheena is a punk rocker '' but were you a `` punk rock girl '' ?
the `` punk rock look '' exploded 40 years ago , and was perceived by some as being deliberately provocative and dangerous .
many people created their own individual diy look , by adapting jumble street buys .
if you have any stories or outfits from the norfolk punk scene , the museum of norwich would love to hear from you .
this saturday , colleagues from its costume and textile department , are looking for people to share their memories of the 70s and 80s , and are looking for punk fashion .
curator ruth battersby tooke says it 's important for the museum 's collections to reflect the recent history : `` we 're really interested in street style .
we have a photographic collection but very little actual clothing . ''
the museum 's collection is used by a huge range of people , including fashion students .
ruth said : '' punk was such an exciting movement this is your chance to become part of the history of norwich . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cannabis farm found at property
text: nearly £ 20,000 worth of cannabis has been seized from a property in fakenham .
norfolk police searched a property in the town , following a tip-off from members of the public .
a man in his 60s and a woman in her 50s were arrested .
they 're on police bail until 19 january 2017 .

documents.title: give a coat for a car wash
text: if you 're planning on getting your car washed in king 's lynn , you may be asked for your coat
the imo car wash is offering a half-price valet to any customers who donate an unwanted coat .
the coats will be passed on to the purfleet trust which supports homeless people .
so far , 50 coats have been collected , and russ hellwig , who runs the car wash , says he 's got more coats to deliver .
the scheme is running until next tuesday .
russ says he 's got great sympathy for those living on the streets at this time of year .
i 've had experience of being in the cold when i was in the army and that was only a week under the stars .
when you have to sleep in the cold it 's different , i feel sorry for those who 're out in the cold . ''
author: Jill Bennett
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: hewett wins at masters event
text: norfolk wheelchair tennis star alfie hewett has won his second match at the nec masters in london .
world number seven hewett beat nicolas peifer 6-0 6-3 , but will now need to beat stephane houdet in his final round robin match to stand any chance of qualifying for the knockout stage .
wimbledon doubles champion hewett was beaten by joachim gerard in his opener .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: academy trust 's plans to turn around school
text: the college of west anglia academy trust ( cwa ) says it 's putting in place a detailed action plan , and additional resources , to address issues raised by a recent inspection of downham market academy by the education advisors ofsted .
david pomfret , chief executive of the cwa , says it recognises that progress towards improving standards of pupil performance in the past two years has n't been sufficient .
mr pomfret says the trust is putting in place a detailed action plan and additional resources to address the issues , in particular around the quality of leadership , weak teaching and learning .
last month , the trust appointed phil hearne as interim principal to oversee the changes required during the rest of the academic year .
phil is a very experienced leader with an impressive record of transforming under-performing schools .
i am confident he will provide strong and inspirational leadership for staff and students . ''

documents.title: concerns over academic standards at school
text: a recent visit by education advisers has highlighted concerns about academic standards at the downham market academy .
problems were found with marking , assessment and feedback to pupils , the trust 's strategy for addressing staffing needs , and its weakness of leadership at the school .
a letter sent to the the college of west anglia academy trust , which runs the school , warns that if things do n't change , ministers could intervene and the school could even be shut down .
the academy has been given to 25 november to outline how it will address the concerns .
the academy trust is the only one in norfolk to be facing a notice of this kind .

documents.title: annual report shows improvement in norfolk 's schools
text: the annual ofsted national report shows big improvement 's for norfolk 's schools .

the county is the fith most-improved local education authority area for the proportion of pupils at `` good '' or `` outstanding '' secondary schools over the past four years , and in 18th place for most improved primary schools .

the report also shows that norfolk is one of the most improved in the east of england for children at the end of early years achieving a `` good level of development '' , putting the county in line with the national level .

documents.title: more pupils at highly-rated primary schools
text: the government 's school inspectors have just published their annual report , and it 's good news for norfolk 's school children .
the ofsted report shows that over the past four years there 's been an increase of 27 % in the number of norfolk pupils attending primary schools rated `` good '' or `` outstanding '' .
that rises to 32 % for those attending secondary schools with those ratings .
author: Tim Addicott
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: wristbands for air travellers needing special assistance
text: a new scheme to help passengers with hidden disabilities is being introduced at norwich airport .
pale blue wristbands will be available for passengers and any companions to wear as a discreet sign to airport staff that additional support might be required while travelling through the airport .
norwich airport has been working with local charities to help make air travel accessible for all , and to help alleviate any fears or anxieties about using the terminal .
the new wristbands will be available from monday , 5 december .

documents.title: author 's delight at the essex serpent winning waterstones ' prize
text: an chelmsford-born writer has spoken of her `` delight '' at winning the waterstones book of the year award with her second novel the essex serpent .
sarah perry ( above ) , who now lives in norwich , .
said : `` i am delighted beyond measure .
`` no author could hope for better champions of their work , or a more heartfelt introduction to readers , and i could not be more grateful . ''
the book was inspired by the folk tales about the serpent of henham , near saffron walden , which was retold in a 17th century pamphlet ( see below ) .
perry faced stiff competition on the six strong shortlist , up against jk rowling 's harry potter and the cursed child - a script based on the west end play of the same name .
also nominated were emma-jane kirby 's the optician of lampedusa , paul kalanithi 's when breath becomes air and meetings with remarkable manuscripts by christopher de hamel .
the final nominee was a beatrix potter novel that was discovered more than 100 years after it was originally written .

the tale of kitty-in-boots - illustrated by quentin blake - tells the story of a well-behaved black cat who leads a double life , and features classic potter characters including mrs tiggy-winkle and peter rabbit .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: duchess of cambridge 's message to hos supporters
text: the duchess of cambridge has been the royal patron of east anglia 's children 's hos since january 2012 , and launched their nook appeal two years ago .
last night 's fundraising event at the natural history musuem featured a message from the duchess , in which she spoke about how the nook will transform children 's palliative care .

`` not only will the nook be a very special place to receive care , it will become a central hub from which the specialist team can co-ordinate , develop and deliver vital services in hundreds of family homes .
`` i am in no doubt the nook will make a huge difference to thousands of children and families for many years to come . ''
she ended her message by wishing guests an enjoyable evening and thanking them for `` helping each move closer to achieving their vision '' .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fayre boost for norfolk church community hub plan
text: a south norfolk church has embarked upon a project to create a community hub where people can come together , meet with friends , and buy a few key shopping items .
author: Network Norfolk

documents.title: one-armed dj in court victory
text: a dj who lost his right arm after a moped crash is in line for a six-figure payout after winning a court victory .
matthew howes , 28 and from norwich , was working in malia , crete in august 2011 , when he swerved to avoid an overtaking car and the scooter he was riding crashed into a safety barrier .
his boss had to give consent for his right arm to be amputated , because mr howes ' mother could n't be contacted .
mr howes , who still works as a dj , made a claim against the motor insurer 's bureau ( mib ) which compensates victims of uninsured or untraced drivers .
mib fought the case , suggesting there was no overtaking car and the crash was caused by the club dj going too fast .
a hearing at the central london county court has ruled in mr howes ' favour .
the amount of compensation is likely to run into six figures .

documents.title: first phase of flood defence work completed
text: the environment agency has completed a £ 28m phase of work to replace over 500m ( 546yds ) of tidal defences in great yarmouth .
during the next phase , a temporary structure will be used to allow engineers to inspect and repair the river wall in a dry environment that would otherwise be under water .
future phases of work will need external funding contributions .
open days for businesses to find out more will be held on 12 december and 10 january .

documents.title: radio presenter honoured for raising awareness of dementia
text: congratulations to bbc radio norfolk 's nick conrad .
the weekday breakfast presenter has been awarded `` outstanding contribution of the year '' by the alzheimer 's society for his work to raise awareness of dementia .

nick , who was unable to get to the ceremony in london yesterday , says it was wonderful to have his name on the trophy , but the award was `` for all the listeners who signed up to be dementia friends , the children who 've gone through the dementia friend programme and the volunteers '' .
we 've got a fantastic place to grow old in , communities that support each other , structures in place , but being a rural county there are challenges and we have to continue building . ''

text: if you did n't get to see ed sheeran 's only live performance of the year , here are some photos of last night 's event at the natural history museum in london .

documents.title: hos appeal nearing the halfway mark
text: the chief executive of east anglia 's children 's hos graham butland , says last night 's gala dinner in aid of their appeal to build a purpose-built hos on the outskirts of norwich was `` spectacular '' .
the evening was hosted by sir martyn lewis , cbe , and included a performance by suffolk singer-songwriter ed sheeran , who is an ambassador for the charity .
mr butland says they 're nearing the halfway point for the £ 10m needed for `` the nook '' - which will be the name of the new hos
we still need your support to make our vision of providing a 21st century building for 21st century care a reality for norfolk families . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: what is the nook appeal ?
text: the east anglia 's children 's hos ( each ) charity provides care for children and young people with life-threatening conditions with hos in ipswich , milton near cambridge and quidenham near thetford in norfolk .
the charity has outgrown its current building in quidenham and has planning permission for a new hos at framingham earl , five miles south of norwich .
the nook , on a five-acre site , will offer services that are currently unavailable or limited at quidenham , such as a hydrotherapy pool , music studio and accessible outside for children to play .
it will also have more areas for clinical care , and a quiet haven area for families .
the charity needs £ 10m to make their vision come true .
each chief executive graham butland says they 're `` well on their way '' , with nearly £ 5m raised since the appeal was launched by its patron , the duchess of cambridge , in november 2014 .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ed sheeran 's cutting comments about scar on his face
text: singer-songwriter ed sheeran joked about getting his face `` cut open '' , as he showed off a scar on his cheek during his exclusive live performance in london last night .
ed , from framlingham in suffolk , made the comments following reports he was cut on the face by princess beatrice during a party prank involving a sword and james blunt .
sheeran , 25 , was performing live in the hintze hall of the natural history musuem , at a fund-raising event for the east anglia 's children 's hos nook appeal .
the musician , who 's an ambassador for the charity , asked the guests to bear with him , as it was `` the first time i 've done a show in a year . ''
`` i practiced for four hours this afternoon , because i 'd forgotten the words to a lot of my songs .
`` i never got the memo about the black tie , i do n't own any black ties - they 're all in the each charity shops . ''
i 've not done much this year , i spent a year in japan and hung out with lots of japanese people and i got my face cut open , what a story . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lynn welcome coach who discovered wayne rooney
text: king 's lynn town have unveiled their latest signing - football consultant ray hall , who discovered wayne rooney at everton 's academy .
hall was academy manager at goodison park for 23 years , he also worked with the likes of ross barkley and jack rodwell .
the linnets have been able to tempt him out of retirement to take up a role as consultant for their youth set up .
he 'll spend three or four days a month at the club , as well as being on the end of the phone to help out .

documents.title: new sewer pipe to reduce risk of flooding in gorleston
text: work has started on replacing a sewer in gorleston , which it 's hoped will reduce the risk of flooding .
anglian water is investing £ 250,000 in the scheme .
it says replacing around 90m ( 295ft ) of sewer main along baker street and riverside road should reduce the risk of bursts on the pressurised section of pipe .
that in turn should protect customers who 've suffered sewer flooding in the past .
the work 's started , but wo n't be finished until the beginning of february .
author: Tom Baker
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: baden powell boat restored
text: the fishing smack baden powell has returned to west norfolk today , as the latest stage of her restoration has been completed .
the boat is more than a century old and was the first to be built in king 's lynn by the worfolk family , who became famous for their sturdy , sea-friendly fishing boats .
the plan is to make the baden powell seaworthy , move her to the waterfront of king 's lynn and use her for cruises in the river great ouse and the wash .
author: Jill Bennett
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: ambulance live : time wasters
text: i 've not heard of any inappropriate calls today to our ambulance control rooms .
however , this year the service says it 's had calls from people calling about an injured seagull , an injured squirrel and a hoax call about a `` drowning goldfish '' .
say no more .

documents.title: ambulance live : the ups and downs of being a paramedic
text: you might remember larry from this morning .
he could n't apologise enough for `` bothering '' the east of england ambulance service crew after he fell and banged his head on a radiator .
patients are not always as nice .
yesterday , john ( was called to a collapse in a cafe toilet .
he went to assist and looked over the top of the door to be met by a hail of abuse from a man who was clearly a street sleeper .
`` i 'm only sleeping .
why do n't you f off , why do you care when i 'm coming out , '' the person said .
he may have only wanted somewhere warm to sleep but of course that took john out of the system .
so while john was waiting to ensure the man could leave under his own steam , it meant he was n't available to assist other patients potentially facing a life-threatening situation .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: city council 's computer system down
text: the computer system at norwich city council has crashed , meaning services to the public may be unavailable for the rest of the day .
a council spokesperson said the whole it system was down while a technical issue was being investigated , and it was unlikely to be resolved until tomorrow .
customers should ring the usual number for any enquiries or emergencies , 01603 412180 .

documents.title: attempted deliveries of bricks , sand and toilets to home mistaken for building site
text: michael whiteley says his house in costessey , called woodlands , bears the same name as a 62-home site being built by bennett homes , nearby on townhouse road .
delivery companies have been attempting to drop off large quantities of construction materials at his detached house since may and have knocked several times to confirm the address is correct .
`` one day my partner came home and a van was in the drive , trying to drop off two portaloos , '' he said .
`` obviously we were n't expecting any , though she joked that we have a long garden , so might be able to use one of them . ''
he has spoken with the developers who offered to erect a sign directing drivers to the site , but mr whiteley said it was too large and not in keeping with his property .

edward parker , from bennett homes , says vehicles may have stopped briefly outside mr whiteley 's home while looking for a building site , but it 's going to `` great lengths '' to stop lorries going there in future .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: house 'mistaken for a building site '
text: building companies have tried to deliver 10,000 bricks , portable toilets , sand and a skip to a house after mistaking it for a building site .
michael whiteley 's home shares the same name as a new development on his road in costessey , near norwich , as the norwich evening news reported .
he said he had turned away several deliveries from confused lorry drivers .
the developers said no items had been left there but have offered to erect a directional sign outside his home .
author: Helen Burchell
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : surpassing targets
text: we often hear about the nhs struggling to meet targets , but that 's not the case today .
the ambulance service has responded to 80.6 % of its highest priority r1 calls within eight minutes .
that 's above the national target of 75 % .
those calls include cardiac arrests and patients not breathing .

documents.title: breakingpolice investigate child abuse within football in norfolk
text: the bbc has discovered that norfolk police is investigating allegations surrounding child abuse within the football community .
in a statement , the force said : `` norfolk constabulary can confirm they are investigating an allegation relating to child abuse within football .
`` we are in the early stages of our investigation and can not comment any further . ''
it brings the total number of forces investigating allegations of child abuse within football nationwide to 14 .

documents.title: school facing closure to stay open for now

ten mile bank riverside school is operated by the diocese of ely multi-academy trust ( demat ) .

the school has been given a reprieve for at least two more years .

documents.title: call-out for female firefighters

the session at carrow fire station hopes to attract more women and people from a range of ethnic backgrounds .
there 'll be the chance to find out more about what the job really involves , and meet those already working in the profession .
firefighter joanne sinclair said : `` i joined the norfolk fire and rescue team last year and it has been a fantastic experience .
`` it 's challenging and can be tough at times , but i 've also found it extremely rewarding . ''

text: so far today , community first responders from the east anglian ambulance service have attended to 16 patients in the east of england .

documents.title: ambulance live : pause for thought
text: one of the things that 's most striking about today is the social care that the east of england ambulance service crews provide .
they spent an hour and a half with larry , who needed his wound glueing after he fell and banged his head on a radiator .
they then called social services , relatives , the gp , the sheltered housing unit and spoke to a neighbour .
it all takes time .
it 's their responsibility not to leave until they are sure he is ok .
we hope larry is back to his old self soon .
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: ambulance live : tea makes it all right
text: we 've got to the important bit : )
it 's time to make larry a brew of 'yorkshire tea ' before we go .
strong with a splash of milk .
`` at 92 i think i 'm doing all right , '' he said .
larry 's local surgery has been alerted to this morning 's incident .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : more on larry
text: i thought you might like to see larry from when he was a rear gunner .
luckily larry wo n't have to go to hospital .
john has checked the wound and is `` knitting '' it together to help it heal as fast as possible .
larry said he healed `` pretty fast '' and refused the offer of a quick haircut from john !
the paramedic team are chatting to larry about the possibility of wearing a pendant round his neck so he can call for medical help should he fall again .
`` i 'm just sad that i 've caused this amount of trouble , '' said larry .
which clearly he has n't .
he 's had a tumble and needed a bit of patching up .
john will make sure larry is booked in for a wound assessment in the next three to five days .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : dangers of a fall
text: as well as having bumped his head , paramedic sharon says it was handy larry had his coat on as this protected him from any burns from the radiator he fell on to .
in the winter , one of the things the crews have to deal with is older people getting burns from hot radiators .
john is tending to larry 's wound using steri strips and glue .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance service had 771 emergency calls before 10:00
text: up until 10:00 today , the east of england ambulance service received 771 emergency calls .
of those , 24 were r1 calls and 289 were r2s .
an r1 or red 1 is a very serious call where a patient has suffered a cardiac arrest or stopped breathing .
two resources should be dispatched to these incidents where possible .
r2 is all other life-threatening emergencies and requires a response in eight minutes .
here 's how they break down by county :
seventy-six for bedfordshire , 118 for cambridgeshire , 219 in essex , 139 in hertfordshire , 113 in norfolk and 106 in suffolk .
busy morning !
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: ambulance live : crew checks on man who fell in home
text: as our day with the east of england ambulance service crew continues , we 're with larry , who had a fall at his home in watton .
as you can see he 's doing fine now .
he slipped off his push-along walker and banged his head on a radiator .
he was about to be up to go shopping when a taxi driver found him and called the ambulance service .
larry says he was a rear gunner in a lancaster and ran 42 missions in his plane , called olivia .
he 's really apologetic for having `` bothered '' the ambulance crew⁠⁠⁠ .
`` i feel a bloody nuisance at the moment , '' he said .
`` you 've got people who are seriously ill . ''
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : on our way to fallen elderly man
text: we 'd been on standby for about 25 minutes before we had a call .
we 're on our way to see a 92-year-old man .
he 's had a fall on his doorstep in watton .
we 're on blue lights through traffic !
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : alex shows us round depot
text: alex is the duty liaison officer who oversees the operation of the east of england ambulance service fleet based in norwich :
with @ twitterid here 's a look around the ambulance prep area at the @ twitterid longwater base # bbcambulances

documents.title: ambulance bosses want to see response time targets changed
text: the east of england ambulance service is hoping its taking part in a trial to improve response times will also lead to the target system being reviewed .

kevin brown , director of service delivery , said : `` with the eight minute target , if we see someone within seven minutes and 59 seconds , it 's seen as a success and if we get there at eight minutes and one second , then it 's a failure , regardless of the outcome for the patient .
`` what we would like to see as a measure is the outcome for the patient . ''

documents.title: ambulance control will get an extra four minutes to assess 999 calls
text: as part of a trial , the east of england ambulance service ( eeas ) control room operators are to get an extra 240 seconds to assess 999 calls .
it 's an attempt to reach the eight minute response time target .
kevin brown , eeas director of service delivery , said : `` it 's allowing us to target the right resource to the right patient .
we have an extra 240 seconds to respond to that from the time of the call . ''
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: brundle preparing for racing 's 'silly season '
text: norfolk racing driver alex brundle says he 's keeping his eyes open for a driving opportunity next season , in what 's known as racing 's silly season .
all those drivers out of contract are trying to find themselves a new drive for the next campaign .
brundle had a brilliant end to the world endurance championship this year , winning the last three races and helping his g-drive team to third place in the championship .
author: Phil Daley
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: ambulance live : meet paramedic co-ordinator sophie
text: sophie is the hospital ambulance liaison officer , taking a look at the arrivals to the norfolk and norwich hospital
sophie works as a halo and works to reduce hospital handovers at the norfolk and norwich hospital # bbcambulances

documents.title: ambulance live : no pit stop , just sweet refuel
text: there 's a mix of onboard snacks today .
one is really healthy the others are good for a happy crew and reporters !
the sweets are 'wild berry ' - probably ca n't count them as part of our five-a-day though .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : on to the next job
text: we were just about to go to diss but have had our route changed to watton , to provide cover on standby in this area .
here 's our reporter nikki fox in full paramedic kit !
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : introducing colin
text: this is colin , he 's the duty locality officer on shift this morning .
it 's his job to coordinate all the crews working in north , south and central norfolk today .
he 's got 23 ambulances today , six rapid response vehicles and a cycle response unit in norwich .
this team basically operates a corridor between cromer , norwich and diss .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : we 've arrived at the hospital
text: the norfolk and norwich is on black alert .
it 's actually now called opel 3 , which is the new official national reporting system .
it means the local health and care system is experiencing severe pressure .
they are short of 70 beds at the moment .
our patient has been handed to the hospital team and she 's now awaiting an x-ray , after her earlier fall .
we 're now leaving .
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: ambulance live : acute medical emergencies dominate time
text: john has been telling me that only about 8-10 % of the workload with the east of england ambulance service crew is dealing with traumas .
the rest is acute medical emergencies and care of the elderly , as we 're an ageing population .
we 're just approaching the hospital - it 's taken about 25 minutes .
we 're in no hurry as our patient is stable and comfortable .
upon arrival at the n & n the patient will be given an x-ray and ecg .
it 's not yet possible to take an x-ray on the ambulances , but some of the vehicles do have ultrasound facilities .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : more on our crew
text: sharon is 40 years old .
she 's a student paramedic and a qualified emergency medical technician .
before that she worked for a pub management company .
being a paramedic is her dream job .
she likes the variety of the job and meeting new people .
the east of england ambulance service really needs people like her , as it has a real shortage of paramedics .
john says his age is `` just a number '' .
he 's been working as a paramedic for 24 years and did 13 years with the east anglian air ambulance .
he now works part-time and says `` it 's all about the patients '' .
`` it 's about making a difference , not just about the worse case scenarios but those social care cases , the care of the elderly and helping to create care pathways ' , '' he said .
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: increase in ambulance response times
text: the reason our reporters are out on an ambulance today is because the bbc is looking at the current state of the services around the country .

new figures collected by the bbc show the percentage of calls to the east of england ambulance service ( eeas ) that took more than 12 minutes to respond to has risen from 14 % to 22 % since 2013 - the second highest in the country .

emergency calls to the ambulance service are broken down into red 1 calls , covering patients who are not breathing and do n't have a pulse , and red 2 calls for patients in a serious condition but who are less immediately time critical , such as those who have had a stroke or fit .
since 2013 , eeas has responded to 208,136 red 1 and red 2 calls that took over 12 minutes to respond to .
in our region , average response times for red 1 calls have increased from six minutes 39 seconds to seven minutes 30 seconds .
average response times for red 2 calls have increased from seven minutes 12 seconds to nine minutes 17 seconds .
author: Robby West
BBC Look East

documents.title: ambulance live : more on the multi-monitors
text: these units are integral in helping the ambulance teams with diagnosis .
they can also send data directly to the hospital , so by the time the patient arrives the hospital already has a full set of observations .
the units cost about £ 17,000 , and the east of england ambulance service has about 400 of them .
they are based in ambulances and rapid response vehicles .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : en route to hospital
text: we 're now en route to the norfolk and norwich university hospital with our first patient of the day .
our patient has had some pain relief and bloods taken , so they can be sent for analysis on arrival at the hospital to speed up her care .
she 's also getting some fluids to make sure she 's hydrated .
the ambulance is equipped with a new `` multi-monitor '' .
it 's a defibrillator which also measures blood pressure and oxygen saturation in the blood , among other things .
author: Martin Barber
BBC News

documents.title: ambulance live : on the road
text: i 'm out with the east of england ambulance service this morning as the bbc spends a day looking at the pressures faced by the ambulance services .
the number of calls received by the service has risen by 30 % since 2013 .
we 're out with the crew sharon and john .
sharon is a first-year student paramedic who is off to university next year .
we had an amusing start as we got in the back of the wrong ambulance !
first call to a 93-year-old lady who has had a fall at a care home in norwich .
she is being taken to the norfolk and norwich hospital .
the east of england ambulance service covers 7,500 square miles and 17 hospitals .
the crew we 're with are doing a 12-hour shift .
it took them just six minutes to get from longwater to thorpe hamlet , in norwich .
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: norwich city u18s thrash watford in cup
text: norwich city 's under-18s made it through to the fourth round of the fa youth cup with an emphatic victory at watford yesterday .
the youngsters won 5-1 at vicarage road .
the canaries have a good recent history in the competition - last season they made it to the quarter-finals .

documents.title: prickly patients at wildlife centre
text: an animal centre in west norfolk has been inundated with prickly patients this year .
the rspca east winch wildlife centre currently has 200 hedgehogs staying at its `` hedgehog hotel '' , and more than 850 have been admitted this year .
many of the hedgehogs were found by members of the public in a dehydrated , weak and hungry state .
the spiny creatures need to weigh around 600g ( 1.3lb ) to be able to hibernate , and two of the 'hogs found wandering around a garden weighed less than a sixth of this .
centre manager alison charles says the tiny patients require as much care as the larger animals they have in their care .

anything people can do to help could make a real difference right now whether it 's a donation to help with their care , tins of pedigree dog food in gravy , or newspapers , small towels or face flannels to give the hedgehogs somewhere to burrow . ''

text: yesterday was a big day for these seal pups .

documents.title: gingerbread 'big ben ' stands proud at 5ft 4in
text: big ben - well , more accurately the elizabeth tower at the houses of parliament - is one of london 's most famous landmarks , and now you can see him in norfolk .
emma thorburn is the maker and creator of this big ben - standing proud at 5ft 4in ( 1.6m ) .
the gingerbread clock took her just nine days to make , and is on display as part of holkham hall 's christmas attraction .
in keeping with his namesake , this big ben really does `` bong '' , with knife and fork hands on the illuminated clockface keeping an accurate pace with the time .
emma has painstakingly attached 1,400 tiny mini gingerbread men around the face , and each of the 80 windows is made of fondant , with edible blue glue , glitter and gelatine `` glass '' .
different kinds of chocolate cover the roof , with 3kg ( 6.6lbs ) of yellow cake sprinkles making the lawn , and 2kg ( 4.4lbs ) of green sprinkles for the grass .
it was delivered in three parts but if you 're hoping to have a slice of this cake , you 're out of luck .
the gingerbread tower will go into storage , and come out again next year - along with this gingerbread house that emma made five years ago .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

text: expectant mothers in west norfolk will be able to give birth in their homes next year .
the board of directors at king 's lynn 's queen elizabeth hospital has approved the reinstatement of the home birth service , which was suspended in september 2013 due to staffing issues .
from february 2017 , women with low-risk pregnancies will now have the option of a home birth .
director of nursing catherine morgan says the hospital 's aim has always been to meet the needs of expectant mums by providing as much choice as possible but safety is their top priority .

they last met only a fortnight ago in the norfolk senior cup with united winning 4-2 , after extra time , to go through to the quarter-finals .

documents.title: coroner 's condolences to family of brothers killed in collision
text: norfolk assistant coroner yvonne blake has given her `` very sincere condolences '' to the family of sam and shane nobbs , who died in a collision on the a140 at horsham st faith .
shane , 23 , and his 20-year-old brother sam died from multiple injuries when their black honda civic car was involved in a collision with a red ldv maxus van on saturday , 19 november .
they were pronounced dead at the scene .
the van driver , a man in his 40s , suffered serious life-changing injuries .
the inquest into the brothers ' deaths was opened at norfolk coroner 's court today , and adjourned until 2 may .

documents.title: burial practice marks a turning point in norfolk 's history
text: the discovery of the grave of a female with jewellery and coins dating back to anglo saxon times is of `` immense importance '' , according to the finds officer for norfolk .
julie shoemark says a number of the pieces found alongside the skeleton reflect the growing influence from the mediterranean region after the anglo saxon conversion to christianity .
within a century of the woman 's death , burial practices had changed and grave goods were no longer interred alongside people .
the woman , says ms shoemark , was `` undoubtedly of some status '' , and the discovery marks an important turning point in the history of norfolk .
the items were unearthed near diss by metal detectorist tom lucking in 2014 , who had initially discovered a bronze bowl .

documents.title: norwich city head to watford in fa youth cup
text: norwich city 's under-18 team begin their bid to win the fa youth cup this evening when they travel to premier league club watford in the a third-round tie .
former ipswich town and canaries full back david wright is now the manager of the city side .
he replaced graeme murty earlier in the month .
norwich city won the competition in 2013 .
that 's the only time in the past five seasons it has n't been won by chelsea .

documents.title: 'treasure trove ' discovery made years of metal detecting worthwhile
text: anglo saxon jewellery unearthed by a metal detectorist exploring a field near diss has been described as of `` national significance '' by the british museum .
the 7cm ( 2.8in ) gold pendant inlaid with garnets was found in the grave of a female , along with other items , by tom lucking in 2014 .
coins in the grave suggest the skeleton and jewellery date from 630-650ad .
it was declared treasure trove at an inquest in norwich yesterday .

mr lucking , 23 , who 's been metal detecting since he was 11 years old , is in the final year of a history degree at the university of east anglia , and says the find makes going out in the cold and rain over the years worthwhile .
julie shoemark , finds officer norfolk county council , said the council wanted to see the items go on display in norwich castle museum if sufficient funds could be raised .

documents.title: biker 'made conscious decision ' to speed
text: nick lloyd , from the royal society for the prevention of accidents ( rospa ) says the motorcyclist who was banned after speeding at 142mph on the a47 in west norfolk had `` made a conscious decision to see how fast his bike could travel '' .

michael cole , solicitor for simon hackett , 45 , of wisbech , told norwich magistrates ' court that his client had only been travelling for 30 seconds when he was clocked by police near king 's lynn in august .
but mr lloyd says it 's difficult to understand what mitigating factors there were .
`` it was n't a mistake he rose very quickly from 70mph to 142mph , '' he said .
it was a conscious decision he placed himself at considerable risk and if there 's been another road user in the vicinity he 'd put that person at risk as well . ''

documents.title: sylvia stuart : six months since last recorded sighting
text: it 's six months today since the last recorded sighting of sylvia stuart , who was reported missing from her home at weybread , near harleston , on friday 3 june , along with her husband peter .
mr stuart 's body was found close to their mill lane home at 19:15 on the same day .
the couple were captured on cctv at goodies farm shop in pulham market on 29 may .
mrs stuart 's body has never been found .
ali qazimaj , who was extradited from luxembourg to face charges over the deaths of mr and mrs stuart , has denied their murder .

documents.title: casualty reduction boss 'surprised ' at leniency of sentence for speeding biker
text: norfolk 's head of casualty reduction says he 's surprised at the sentence handed down to a motorcyclist caught speeding at 142mph ( 229km/h ) on the a47 near king 's lynn .
simon hackett , a self-employed carpenter from wisbech , was riding home after an outing to hunstanton on 21 august when he was clocked by police .
he was banned from driving for 60 days , fined £ 250 and ordered to pay costs of £ 115 at norwich magistrates ' court yesterday .
iain temperton said he usually tried not to comment on sentencing , but was surprised at how lenient this one was .
you think to yourself 'how can somebody be that stupid to take a bike out on the public highway and rattle through at essentially twice the speed limit ? '
it 's a ridiculous thing to do . ''

documents.title: 'collision at 142mph has only one outcome ' says former roads policing officer
text: yesterday we reported on biker simon hackett , given a 60-day driving ban after he was caught speeding at 142mph ( 229km/h ) on the a47 at terrington st john .

chris spinks , former head of roads policing in norfolk said it was rare for people to be travelling at this sort of speed `` well in excess of a mile every 30 seconds '' and very few people were able to drive at those speeds and be in full control of their vehicle .

`` the thought of somebody going at those speeds weaving in and out of traffic does n't bear thinking about if you 're involved in a collision at that speed i can only envisage one outcome for a motorcyclist - and that 's fatal '' .
hackett , 45 , from wisbech , was also ordered to pay a fine and costs amounting to just over £ 350 , at norwich magistrates ' court yesterday .

mr sprinks said he could see why people might think it a light sentence , compared with a 12-month ban for drink- or drug-driving , but that `` two months without a licence will cause problems '' for the self-employed carpenter and may cost him a financial penalty when he has to insure his vehicles again .

documents.title: funding to fill in potholes
text: a smoother journey could be in store for travellers on our roads .
the government is giving nearly £ 2.5m to fix norfolk 's potholes over the next two years .
it claims that 's enough to deal with 47,000 potholes - either filling them in or preventing them from forming or getting worse .
the money is part of £ 9.7m for the east of england enough to fix around 183,000 potholes in 2017/18 .

documents.title: £ 3.8m project to transform primary school
text: a south norfolk primary school is getting nine new classrooms as part of a £ 3.8m project .
the work on ashleigh primary near wymondham will include a new kitchen , hall extension and remodelling of other parts of the school .

the project is part of a reorganisation by norfolk county council to increase the number of primary school places in the town from 1050 and 1260 , which also includes the robert kett , browick road and ashleigh schools .
the work at ashleigh primary is expected to be completed for the start of the 2017/18 school year .
head teacher sam nixon says the end result will be worth `` any small disruptions to normal school life during the build '' .
we are looking forward to the children being involved in the process and they have already submitted eco-friendly suggestions to nps based on their work in class . ''

documents.title: stolen geese could be worth up to £ 100,000
text: the geese stolen from land near norwich yesterday could be worth up to £ 100,000 in value .
that 's the view of john newton , nfu county advisor for norfolk .
mr newton says the 1,500 geese were `` clearly stolen to order they 're not the kind of numbers you could sell down your local pub '' .
mr newton says it was certainly `` an audacious theft '' , usually if birds are stolen in the lead up to christmas it 's `` a small handful '' .
the birds are potentially very heavy , he adds , and difficult to catch - particularly at night-time when the theft occurred , but there 's not much to be done to prevent the thefts .
remain vigilant , report sus sightings to the police but there 's much practically that can be done when you 've got free range birds out in fields at night time or during the day . ''

documents.title: motorcyclist disqualified for doing 142mph on a47
text: a motorcyclist who was caught doing 142mph ( 230km/h ) in a 70mph ( 110km/h ) limit has been disqualified from driving for 60 days and fined .
simon hackett , 45 , from arles avenue in wisbech was clocked by an officer with a hand-held laser gun as he was riding on the a47 at terrington st john on 21 august .
hackett who pleaded guilty to the offence at norwich magistrates court was caught on a sunny afternoon .

his defence michael cole said hackett had only ridden at speed for about 30 seconds on the empty stretch of road and `` had he not slowed down the police would not have been able to catch up with him '' .
but the chairman of magistrates , howard gill , said the `` dangers of coming off the bike or someone stepping out in front of you does n't bear thinking about . ''
as well as the ban mr hackett was fined £ 250 with costs of £ 115 .

text: these taken by bbc cameraman shaun whitmore , show all that 's left of a 19th century house on the bewilderwood estate near wroxham which was destroyed in a fire overnight .
the house , which was let out to holidaymakers , was unoccupied when the blaze broke out .
at the height of the incident , nine fire appliances and 60 firefighters were on scene .
the bewilderwood estate , at hoveton , is owned by tom blofeld .
he , his father and grandfather had all lived in the house over the generations .
a fire investigation team is on site to establish the cause of the blaze , which is not thought to be sus

text: there was something rather fishy going on at brancaster in north norfolk at the weekend .
beach walkers could be forgiven for thinking they 'd walked into the set of a deep-sea movie .
the giant sea creatures were for a marine-themed stag and hen party , for sara underwood and long-time partner andy york ( immediately below ) .
the couple , from brigstock in northamptonshire , are getting married in three weeks ' time .
sara , 50 , had always wanted to be an octopus and says the nautical stag-do was a perfect ice-breaker for friends and family .
like most friends of the bride-to-be , beth jones chose her outfit carefully coming as seaweed , with husband steve dressed as a cleaner fish .
fifty guests joined the seaside spectacle , with some coming from as far away as cornwall .
sara 's parents , tony and sue underwood ( as seahorse and parrot fish ) have a holiday home in brancaster , and the area has wonderful childhood memories for sara .
what could be a better way to brighten up a cold november day ?
after paddles and photographs on the sea shore , the party - including jellyfish , mermaids , octopus and an 8ft cod - headed off for a supper of fish and chips .
`` the sun shone , the sea was a silvery colour dog owners frantically trying to stop their pets from grabbing tentacles of the octopus i woke up this morning thinking did this happen ? ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: webster has best ever run at tournament
text: norwich darts player darren webster had his best ever result at a major tournament at the weekend .
the `` demolition man '' reached the semi-finals of the players championship in minehead but lost out to the eventual tournament winner and world number one michael van gerwen .
webster had led the dutchman by six legs to nil before eventually losing out 11-8 .
the 48-year-old will now prepare for the world championships in london which start next month .
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: 'bewilderwood ' house destroyed in blaze
text: firefighters have been working through the night to control a large fire at a property near wroxham .
the blaze broke out at around 22:00 , on lower street , hoveton , at the estate owned by the blofeld family , who run the bewilderwood adventure park .
at its height nine crews , with 60 firefighters , were there .
the rural location made it difficult for the crews to source water , norfolk fire and rescue service said .
the home , which stood alone in a field , has been completely destroyed .
nobody was injured in the blaze .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norwich city boss 'can handle the pressure from fans '
text: norwich city lost their fifth consecutive championship match on saturday .
former canary bradley johnson scored the decisive goal for derby county at pride park , the game finished 1-0 .
city are now out of the play-off places and in eighth position in the division .
i get pressure every week in football .
i put enough pressure on myself , anybody else 's is secondary from that . ''
author: Rob Butler
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: man arrested on sus of attempted murder
text: a 28-year-old man is being questioned by police on sus of attempted murder .
the man , from ipswich , was arrested by firearms officers at an address in magpie road , norwich on saturday , 26 november .
it 's after an 18-year-old man suffered a gunshot wound to his shoulder in ipswich , in the early hours of tuesday , 22 november .
his injuries are not life-threatening , police said .
